title: Mark Mom
text:
Mark Mom is a Papua New Guinean <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who represented <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea</a> in the <a href="2000%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2000 World Cup</a>.
Playing career.
Mom attended <a href="St%20John%27s%20College%2C%20Woodlawn">St John's College, Woodlawn</a> in Australia and played for the <a href="Australian%20Schoolboys%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian Schoolboys'</a> side.
In 1994 he played for the <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea</a> side at the 1994 <a href="Rugby%20League%20World%20Sevens">World Sevens</a>.
Between 1996 and 2001 he played eight test matches for the Kumuls, including four at the <a href="2000%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2000 World Cup</a>.
